content: Bumble Bee Foods and two of its managers have been charged with violating safety regulations after an employee died in an industrial oven being used to process tuna. Jose Melena was carrying out maintenance work on the oven in the company‚Äôs Santa Fe Springs plant when a co-worker accidentally switched it on, apparently unaware that Melena was inside. His body was found two hours later when the oven was opened. Prosecutors from Los Angeles have charged the company, Operations Director Angel Rodriguez and former safety manager Saul Florez each with three counts of violating Occupational Safety & Health Administration rules that led to the fatality. Bumble Bee Foods faces fines of up to $1.5m, whilst Rodriguez and Florez could be imprisoned for three years and fined up to $250k.
